炸.definition: to burst; to explode; to blow up; to bomb; (coll.) to fly into a rage; (coll.) to scamper off; to scatter

炸兩.definition: (Cantonese cuisine) zhaliang, rice noodle rolls 腸粉|肠粉[chang2 fen3] stuffed with youtiao 油條|油条[you2 tiao2]

炸土豆條兒.definition: erhua variant of 炸土豆條|炸土豆条[zha2 tu3 dou4 tiao2]

炸垮.definition: to blow up (demolish with an explosion)

炸彈之母.definition: Massive Ordinance Air Blast (MOAB), or Mother of All Bombs, a powerful American bomb

炸彈之父.definition: Aviation Thermobaric Bomb of Increased Power (ATBIP), or Father of All Bombs, a powerful Russian bomb

炸燬.definition: to blow up; to destroy with explosives

炸碎.definition: to destroy in an explosion; to break (by bombing)

炸膛.definition: (of a gun) to explode; to blow up

炸街.definition: (slang) (of a car driver) to engage in noisy, disruptive showboating

炸裂.definition: to burst; to explode; to rupture

炸醬麵.definition: zhajiang mian, thick wheat noodles served with ground pork simmered in salty fermented soybean paste (or other sauce)

炸鍋.definition: (of food) to burst out of the pot; (fig.) to be in an uproar
